name: async-monitor.js
description: A lightweight and efficient monitoring engine designed to seamlessly track and manage hierarchically organized asynchronous JavaScript functions. Perfect for developers looking to streamline and gain insights into complex async workflows, ensuring reliable performance and easy debugging.

scripts.build: rimraf dist .tmp && node scripts/write-version.js && npm run prettier -- --write && npm run tsc && npm run rollup-build && npm run minify
scripts.dev: (npm run tsc-watch -- --preserveWatchOutput & p1=$!; npm run rollup-build -- --watch & p2=$!; wait $p1 $p2)
scripts.minify: terser dist/async-monitor.cjs -o dist/async-monitor.min.cjs && terser dist/async-monitor.esm.js -o dist/async-monitor.min.esm.js && terser dist/async-monitor.amd.js -o dist/async-monitor.min.amd.js && terser dist/async-monitor.umd.js -o dist/async-monitor.min.umd.js
scripts.prepare: npm run test && npm run build
scripts.release:major: npm version major --message 'v%s' && npm publish && npm run _release:push-branch
scripts.release:minor: npm version minor --message 'v%s' && npm publish && npm run _release:push-branch
scripts.release:patch: npm version patch --message 'v%s' && npm publish && npm run _release:push-branch

author: monitor.js contributors (https://github.com/manulykebe/async-monitor.js/graphs/contributors)
